name: Snowdonia
description: Mountains, zip lines, gorge walking, slate mines. Wales' adventure epicentre.

name: Pembrokeshire
description: Coasteering capital. Dramatic cliffs, hidden coves, sea kayaking, surfing.

name: Brecon Beacons
description: Waterfalls, caving, hiking, horse riding. Gentler than Snowdonia but still wild.

name: Gower
description: Surf beaches, cliff walks, coastal camping. Closest adventure to Cardiff/Swansea.

name: Anglesey
description: Sea kayaking, coasteering, kitesurfing. Underrated island with unique geology.

name: Ll≈∑n Peninsula
description: Remote beaches, sailing, coastal walks. Quieter alternative to Pembrokeshire.

name: Mid Wales
description: Mountain biking, wild camping, empty hills. Wales' empty quarter.

name: Wye Valley
description: Canoeing, climbing, forest trails. Adventure on the Welsh-English border.

name: North Wales Coast
description: Family beaches, bike trails, Great Orme. Gateway to Snowdonia.

name: South Wales Valleys
description: BikePark Wales, trail centres, industrial heritage adventures.

name: Carmarthenshire
description: Rolling hills, river kayaking, horse riding. Quiet rural adventures.
